MonALISA
MonALISA

• Mature OSG-wide real-time monitoring of jobs • Provides templates for charting job and
• Mature OSG-wide real-time monitoring of jobs
• Provides templates for charting job and

workflow progress on a site or per a collection of sites used by a Virtual Organization.
workflow progress on a site or per a collection
of sites used by a Virtual Organization.

• Provides historical database records on past

usage.
usage.

Virtual Organization(VO) Issues
Virtual Organization(VO) Issues

• Your Grid Certificate is tied to a specific VO. • Each VO has a VO administrator. The VO admin manages a
• Your Grid Certificate is tied to a specific VO.
• Each VO has a VO administrator. The VO admin manages a

VOMS server.
VOMS server.

• VOMS – Virtual Organization Membership Service is a DB
• VOMS – Virtual Organization Membership Service is a DB

which collects all the membership information for the organization.
which collects all the membership information for the
organization.

• The Globus gatekeeper authentication process references your identity information from VOMS to determine if you are to be authenticated when you attempt to run a Globus job or GSIFTP a file.
• The Globus gatekeeper authentication process references your
identity information from VOMS to determine if you are to be
authenticated when you attempt to run a Globus job or GSIFTP
a file.

Virtual Organization(VO) Issues
Virtual Organization(VO) Issues

• Why can’t I run a job at site X?
• Why can’t I run a job at site X?

– The site X may not support your VO. A
– The site X may not support your VO. A

Production site on the OSG is not required to support all VOs. (check with your VO admin) – The site X may require additional configuration
Production site on the OSG is not required to
support all VOs. (check with your VO admin)
– The site X may require additional configuration

to support your VO (missing VO home directory, wrong permissions, no VO grid mapping) Your VO admin may need the GOC to fix this.
to support your VO (missing VO home directory,
wrong permissions, no VO grid mapping) Your
VO admin may need the GOC to fix this.

Grid Operations Center
Grid Operations Center

• Based at Indiana University and provides a central repository of staff and monitoring systems for: – Real time grid monitoring. – Problem tracking via a trouble ticket system. – Support for developers and sys admins. – Maintains infrastructure – VORS, MonALISA and
• Based at Indiana University and provides a
central repository of staff and monitoring
systems for:
– Real time grid monitoring.
– Problem tracking via a trouble ticket system.
– Support for developers and sys admins.
– Maintains infrastructure – VORS, MonALISA and

registration DB.
registration DB.

– Maintains OSG software repositories.
– Maintains OSG software repositories.

We need to specify the gatekeeper (second column above) for a site:
We need to specify the gatekeeper (second column above) for a site:

globus-job-run grid3.aset.psu.edu /bin/date Sun Mar 4 00:30:02 EST 2007
globus-job-run grid3.aset.psu.edu /bin/date
Sun Mar 4 00:30:02 EST 2007

GRAM Authentication test successful

Running jobs on the OSG
Running jobs on the OSG

• globusrun and globus-job-run can be used for
• globusrun and globus-job-run can be used for

complex job specifications: – Batch schedulers supported include:
complex job specifications:
– Batch schedulers supported include:

• Condor, LSF, PBS and SGE
• Condor, LSF, PBS and SGE

– To access many nodes on a remote resource specify the proper batch scheduler used at that site:
– To access many nodes on a remote resource
specify the proper batch scheduler used at that
site:

globus-job-run grid3.aset.psu.edu/jobmanager-pbs /bin/date Command is queued on the batch scheduler and will run when
globus-job-run grid3.aset.psu.edu/jobmanager-pbs /bin/date
Command is queued on the batch scheduler and will run when

the job reaches the front of the queue. The job may wait in the queue for minutes to hours depending on your priority and how busy the resource is.
the job reaches the front of the queue. The job may wait in the
queue for minutes to hours depending on your priority and
how busy the resource is.

Running jobs on the Grid
Running jobs on the Grid

• Globus is built on a Resource Specification Language
• Globus is built on a Resource Specification Language

(RSL) which can control batch schedulers that manage clusters. • An RSL example:
(RSL) which can control batch schedulers that
manage clusters.
• An RSL example:

• &(executable=“/bin/ls”) (directory=“/tmp”) (arguments=“-l”) • Place the RSL string in a file: myjob.rsl • Try: globusrun -s -r osg-itb.ligo.caltech.edu -f myjob.rsl • Try globusrun –s –r osg-itb.ligo.caltech.edu/jobmanager-
• &(executable=“/bin/ls”) (directory=“/tmp”) (arguments=“-l”)
• Place the RSL string in a file: myjob.rsl
• Try: globusrun -s -r osg-itb.ligo.caltech.edu -f myjob.rsl
• Try globusrun –s –r osg-itb.ligo.caltech.edu/jobmanager-

condor –f myjob.rsl
condor –f myjob.rsl

– But for more robust job management use Condor-G!
– But for more robust job management use Condor-G!

Quick Start Guide to the OSG

GridFTP: File transfer and staging
GridFTP: File transfer and staging

• GridFTP is the globus protocol for transferring files between: – Grid clients (submit hosts) and grid Compute Elements. • Support multiple simultaneously streams for high performance. • Supports third-party copy: Host A requests Host B transfer files
• GridFTP is the globus protocol for transferring files between:
– Grid clients (submit hosts) and grid Compute Elements.
• Support multiple simultaneously streams for high performance.
• Supports third-party copy: Host A requests Host B transfer files

• globus-url-copy is a wrapper on GridFTP with a convenient
• globus-url-copy is a wrapper on GridFTP with a convenient

to Host C.
to Host C.

syntax.
syntax.

OSG Consortium Mtg March 2007 Quick Start Guide to the OSG
OSG Consortium Mtg March 2007
Quick Start Guide to the OSG

globus-url-copy
globus-url-copy

• Syntax: globus-url-copy source-url destination-url
• Syntax: globus-url-copy source-url destination-url

• Example:
• Example:

globus-url-copy gsiftp://osg-itb.ligo.caltech.edu/archive/frames/H-H1_RDS-1024.gwf
globus-url-copy gsiftp://osg-itb.ligo.caltech.edu/archive/frames/H-H1_RDS-1024.gwf

gsiftp://testwulf.hpcc.ttu.edu/mnt/hep/osg/workdir/H-H1_RDS-1024.gwf
gsiftp://testwulf.hpcc.ttu.edu/mnt/hep/osg/workdir/H-H1_RDS-1024.gwf

Many options exist. Please see the globus-url-copy of the GridIFTP User’s Guide: http://www.globus.org/toolkit/docs/3.2/gridftp/user/globusurlcopy.html#commandlineoptions for details.
Many options exist. Please see the globus-url-copy of the GridIFTP User’s Guide:
http://www.globus.org/toolkit/docs/3.2/gridftp/user/globusurlcopy.html#commandlineoptions
for details.

Condor-G/DAGman
Condor-G/DAGman

• Globus virtualized the interface to high performance
• Globus virtualized the interface to high performance

computing resources and file transfers.
computing resources and file transfers.

• However, run-time event management in distributed
• However, run-time event management in distributed

systems is needed: – Gatekeeper may be down. – GridFTP server may be down. – Operating system may become unresponsive. – Batch scheduler may become unresponsive. – Submit host may not be able to stage-out results of a
systems is needed:
– Gatekeeper may be down.
– GridFTP server may be down.
– Operating system may become unresponsive.
– Batch scheduler may become unresponsive.
– Submit host may not be able to stage-out results of a

job due to a full disk.
job due to a full disk.

• Condor-G/DAGman provides a means to monitor and manage end-to-end events during a Grid application execution.
• Condor-G/DAGman provides a means to monitor and
manage end-to-end events during a Grid application
execution.

OSG Consortium Mtg March 2007 Quick Start Guide to the OSG
OSG Consortium Mtg March 2007
Quick Start Guide to the OSG

Condor-G/DAGman
Condor-G/DAGman

• Condor folks created the globus universe. Condor scripts
• Condor folks created the globus universe. Condor scripts

submitted to the globus universe are submitted to a Globus gatekeeper or GridFTP server and use all of the resources of Globus jobs.
submitted to the globus universe are submitted to a Globus
gatekeeper or GridFTP server and use all of the resources
of Globus jobs.

• Condor scripts are submitted by the user running a Condor
• Condor scripts are submitted by the user running a Condor

client and having a local condor queue. So Grid job management is simplified for the user due to Condor toolset: – condor_submit: submit a condor script. – condor_q: check the status of a condor job. – condor_rm: remove a condor job from the queue.
client and having a local condor queue. So Grid job
management is simplified for the user due to Condor
toolset:
– condor_submit: submit a condor script.
– condor_q: check the status of a condor job.
– condor_rm: remove a condor job from the queue.

OSG Consortium Mtg March 2007 Quick Start Guide to the OSG
OSG Consortium Mtg March 2007
Quick Start Guide to the OSG

A simple Condor-G script
A simple Condor-G script

universe = globus executable = /bin/ls notification = NEVER globusrsl = (jobtype=single) globusscheduler = osg-itb.ligo.caltech.edu/jobmanager-condor copy_to_spool = false error = /home/dmeyers/osg-itb.err log = /home/dmeyers/osg-itb.log output = /home/dmeyers/osg-itb.out transfer_executable = false transfer_error = true transfer_output = true periodic_release = (NumSystemHolds <= 3) periodic_remove = (NumSystemHolds > 3) remote_initialdir = /home/dmeyers queue
universe = globus
executable = /bin/ls
notification = NEVER
globusrsl = (jobtype=single)
globusscheduler = osg-itb.ligo.caltech.edu/jobmanager-condor
copy_to_spool = false
error = /home/dmeyers/osg-itb.err
log = /home/dmeyers/osg-itb.log
output = /home/dmeyers/osg-itb.out
transfer_executable = false
transfer_error = true
transfer_output = true
periodic_release = (NumSystemHolds <= 3)
periodic_remove = (NumSystemHolds > 3)
remote_initialdir = /home/dmeyers
queue

OSG Consortium Mtg March 2007 Quick Start Guide to the OSG
OSG Consortium Mtg March 2007
Quick Start Guide to the OSG

DAGman
DAGman

• DAG manager (DAGman) is an extension to the Condor system
• DAG manager (DAGman) is an extension to the Condor system

that adds a Directed Acyclic Graph(DAG) abstraction.
that adds a Directed Acyclic Graph(DAG) abstraction.

• Many scientific and engineering workflows can be modeled as a
• Many scientific and engineering workflows can be modeled as a

collection of DAG nodes.
collection of DAG nodes.

• Each DAG node is tracked and its status determined by the
• Each DAG node is tracked and its status determined by the

DAG manager. Errors are handled by auto-restarting a failed node to increase reliability. Condor has the notion of a rescue DAG which represents the place in the Graph where a workflow can be restarted from, to resume a workflow.
DAG manager. Errors are handled by auto-restarting a failed
node to increase reliability. Condor has the notion of a rescue
DAG which represents the place in the Graph where a workflow
can be restarted from, to resume a workflow.

OSG Consortium Mtg March 2007 Quick Start Guide to the OSG
OSG Consortium Mtg March 2007
Quick Start Guide to the OSG

DAGman
DAGman

Diamond DAG
Diamond DAG

An example input file for DAGMan is # Filename: diamond.dag Job A A.condor Job B B.condor Job C C.condor Job D D.condor Script PRE A top_pre.csh Script PRE B mid_pre.perl $JOB Script POST B mid_post.perl $JOB $RETURN Script PRE C mid_pre.perl $JOB Script POST C mid_post.perl $JOB $RETURN Script PRE D bot_pre.csh PARENT A CHILD B C PARENT B C CHILD D Retry C 3
An example input file for DAGMan is
# Filename: diamond.dag
Job A A.condor
Job B B.condor
Job C C.condor
Job D D.condor
Script PRE A top_pre.csh
Script PRE B mid_pre.perl $JOB
Script POST B mid_post.perl $JOB $RETURN
Script PRE C mid_pre.perl $JOB
Script POST C mid_post.perl $JOB $RETURN
Script PRE D bot_pre.csh
PARENT A CHILD B C
PARENT B C CHILD D
Retry C 3

http://www.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v6.4/2_11DAGMan_Applications.html#fig:dagman-diamond

Automatic Tools exist to convert DAGs into Condor-G submit scripts that can be run with the Condor command: condor- submit-dag.
Automatic Tools exist to convert DAGs into Condor-G submit
scripts that can be run with the Condor command: condor-
submit-dag.

One of these tools is the Pegasus Workflow Planner described
One of these tools is the Pegasus Workflow Planner described

at: http://pegasus.isi.edu/
at: http://pegasus.isi.edu/
